meanings.definition: A lower ceiling, typically found in a room with a dropped ceiling.
meanings.sent1: The subceilings in the basement make the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent2: The workers installed subceilings to hide the wiring and pipes.
meanings.sent3: The subceilings whispered secrets to each other in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent4: The subceilings held onto the warmth of the day long after the sun had set.
meanings.sent5: The subceilings seemed to embrace you like a comforting hug from above.

meanings.definition: The underside of a ceiling, especially in reference to a secondary ceiling below the main one.
meanings.sent1: We painted the subceilings a calming shade of blue to match the walls.
meanings.sent2: The subceilings reflected the light, making the room appear brighter.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to hide on the subceilings, thinking it was the perfect spot.
meanings.sent4: The subceilings seemed to mirror the sky above, creating an illusion of endless space.
meanings.sent5: The subceilings cradled the room like a protective shield against the outside world.
